item.title: Julianna add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Chief Joseph
item.description: "It does not require many words to speak the truth." -- Chief Joseph

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "My religion consists of a humble admiration of the illimitable superior spirit who reveals himself in the slight details we are able to perceive with our frail and feeble mind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Clifton Fadiman
item.description: "When you reread a classic you do not see more in the book than you did before; you see more in you than there was before." -- Clifton Fadiman

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Julianna add a quote by John Bunyan
item.description: "In prayer it is better to have a heart without words than words without a heart. " -- John Bunyan

item.title: Julianna add a quote by William R. Inge
item.description: "Religion is a way of walking, not a way of talking." -- William R. Inge

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Julianna add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "A thing of beauty is a joy forever." -- John Keats

item.title: Julianna add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "Ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Robert F. Kennedy
item.description: "There are those that look at things the way they are, and ask why? I dream of things that never were, and ask why not?" -- Robert F. Kennedy

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "We must live together as brothers or perish together as fools." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Faith is taking the first step even when you can't see the whole staircase." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "A good head and good heart are always a formidable combination. But when you add to that a literate tongue or pen, then you have something very special." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "We know only too well that what we are doing is nothing more than a drop in the ocean. But if the drop were not there, the ocean would be missing something." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "I am not sure exactly what heaven will be like, but I know that when we die and it comes time for God to judge us, he will not ask, 'How many good things have you done in your life?' rather he will ask, 'How much love did you put into what you did?" -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "The only thing we have to fear is fear itself." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "Let him who would move the world first move himself." -- Socrates

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Aung San Suu Kyi
item.description:
"In societies where men are truly confident of their own worth, women are not merely tolerated but valued."
(From a speech read on video on August 31, 1995 before the NGO Forum on Women, Beijing, China)" -- Aung San Suu Kyi

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Barack Obama
item.description: "We are the change we have been waiting for." -- Barack Obama

item.title: Julianna add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero
